titles.title: Social Security Children's Benefits Act of 1987
A bill to amend title II of the Social Security Act to restore from age sixteen to age eighteen the age of a child at which certain benefits under such title are terminated.

action.text: Referred to House Committee on Ways and Means.
Referred to Subcommittee on Social Security.

term.name: Old age, survivors and disability insurance

bill.summary: 4/7/1987--Introduced. Social Security Children's Benefits Act of 1987 - Amends title II (Old Age, Survivors and Disability Insurance) of the Social Security Act to terminate a nondisabled child's entitlement to child's insurance benefits when such child reaches age 18. (Currently, such entitlement ceases when the child reaches age 16.)
